Package assignmentJava.gui

Class TopMenuBar

java.lang.Object
com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.AbstractComponent<com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.menu.MenuBar>
com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.menu.MenuBar
assignmentJava.gui.TopMenuBar
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.BasePaneListener<com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.Window>, com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.Component, com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.Container, com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.TextGUIElement, com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.WindowListener
public class TopMenuBar extends com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.menu.MenuBar implements com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.WindowListener
This class is a Menu Bar that listens to the key presses inside the main window and triggers various menus. Activating menus will trigger a change in the main panel of the main window. Each menu has an associated Runnable that is executed when the Menu is activated. Runnables have been replaced with lambda expressions where possible to simplify the code.

  • Nested Class Summary

    • onInput

      public void onInput(com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.Window basePane, com.googlecode.lanterna.input.KeyStroke keyStroke, AtomicBoolean deliverEvent)
      This menu bar handles input from the keyboard to map key combos of the form "Alt - X" to the different menus, where X is one of {F, M, C, D, S, P, O}. Each combo triggers a specific menu. If Ctrl - W is pressed, the panel that's in focus is closed.
      Specified by:
      onInput in interface com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.BasePaneListener<com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.Window>
      Parameters:
      basePane - The base pane of this menu bar
      keyStroke - Tne KeyStroke that was pressed
      deliverEvent - Should this event be delivered to the component that is currently under focus

    • getTextGUI

      public com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.WindowBasedTextGUI getTextGUI()
      Description copied from interface: com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.Component
      Returns the TextGUI that this component is currently part of. If the component hasn't been added to any container or in any other way placed into a GUI system, this method will return null.
      Specified by:
